pr_title: Add a note indicating Kibana will not recognize monitoring data unless it has something from the active master

timeline.bodyText: @PhaedrusTheGreek - Some monitoring data is sourced from data nodes as well as master nodes. I think the comment here is a bit confusing calling out master node directly. This feels more like a troubleshooting comment then a reference guide comment.
timeline.author: jakelandis
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -43,7 +43,8 @@ For more information, see <<monitoring-settings>> and <<cluster-update-settings>
 --
 
 . {metricbeat-ref}/metricbeat-installation-configuration.html[Install {metricbeat}] on each
-{es} node in the production cluster.
+{es} node in the production cluster (Monitoring data must be collected from at least the currently 
+active master node in order for Kibana to display it)

replies.bodyText: Maybe so.  The documentation already states that monitoring agent must be installed on ALL nodes in the cluster - perhaps we should make that requirement more prominent?
replies.author: PhaedrusTheGreek

replies.bodyText: Maybe ...{es} node in the production cluster. Failure to install on each node may result in incomplete or missing results. ?
replies.author: jakelandis
